newsitem.title: USA: Sears to proceed with MaxServ tender offer.
newsitem.headline: Sears to proceed with MaxServ tender offer.

text.p: Sears, Roebuck and Co said Tuesday it intends to complete its $7-a-share tender offer for MaxServ Inc, after being rebuffed by MaxServ for the second time in a month.
Sears, which launched its first-ever hostile takeover on February 4, said a special committee of MaxServ board members has refused to meet unless the retailer raises its offer to $8 a share.
Sears said it concluded there is little or no likelihood of reaching a negotiated transaction, and therefore it will proceed with its original tender offer.
Sears originally offered to buy the 35.6 percent of MaxServ shares it doesn't already own for about $27 million. MaxServ's board rejected the proposal.
The retailer has been a MaxServ customer since 1983 and accounts for more than 90 percent of the information services company's annual revenues.
